content.content: 1. (1) This Regulation applies when a board declares the position of a principal or vice-principal to be redundant. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 1 (1). (2) This Regulation applies when any of the following positions is declared to be redundant: 1. Principal or vice-principal of continuing education courses and classes that are offered for credit during the day on instructional days. 2. Principal or vice-principal who administers the board’s program of continuing education courses and classes that are offered for credit. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 1 (2). (3) This Regulation does not apply when the position of principal or vice-principal of continuing education courses and classes that is not described in subsection (2) is declared to be redundant. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 1 (3). (4) A position is redundant if the board decides that the position is no longer required because of, (a) the implementation of a restructuring plan that eliminates the position or merges it with another position; (b) a reduction in the number of classes or schools of the board; or (c) a change in the board’s duties under any Act. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 1 (4).
content.raw_html:
1. (1) This Regulation applies when a board declares the position of a principal or vice-principal to be redundant. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 1 (1).

(2) This Regulation applies when any of the following positions is declared to be redundant:

1. Principal or vice-principal of continuing education courses and classes that are offered for credit during the day on instructional days.

2. Principal or vice-principal who administers the board’s program of continuing education courses and classes that are offered for credit. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 1 (2).

(3) This Regulation does not apply when the position of principal or vice-principal of continuing education courses and classes that is not described in subsection (2) is declared to be redundant. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 1 (3).

(4) A position is redundant if the board decides that the position is no longer required because of,

(a) the implementation of a restructuring plan that eliminates the position or merges it with another position;

(b) a reduction in the number of classes or schools of the board; or

(c) a change in the board’s duties under any Act. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 1 (4).

content.content: 2. (1) The board shall give the affected principal or vice-principal notice in writing that his or her position is declared to be redundant. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 2 (1). (2) The notice must be given at least 90 days before the date on which the position becomes redundant. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 2 (2). (3) The notice must specify the date on which the position becomes redundant. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 2 (3). (4) The board may rescind the notice at any time. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 2 (4). (5) Revoked: O. Reg. 90/98, s. 2 (6). (6) Spent: O. Reg. 90/98, s. 2 (6).
content.raw_html:
2. (1) The board shall give the affected principal or vice-principal notice in writing that his or her position is declared to be redundant. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 2 (1).

(2) The notice must be given at least 90 days before the date on which the position becomes redundant. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 2 (2).

(3) The notice must specify the date on which the position becomes redundant. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 2 (3).

(4) The board may rescind the notice at any time. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 2 (4).

(5) Revoked: O. Reg. 90/98, s. 2 (6).

(6) Spent: O. Reg. 90/98, s. 2 (6).

content.content: 3. (1) The board shall assign the principal or vice-principal to another position for which he or she is qualified. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 3 (1). (2) The principal or vice-principal may be assigned to a position in a teachers’ bargaining unit if the position is vacant after the procedures under the applicable collective agreement for filling it have been exhausted. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 3 (2). (3) The assignment takes effect on the date on which the principal’s or vice-principal’s position becomes redundant, or on such other date as the board and the principal or vice-principal may agree upon. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 3 (3).
content.raw_html:
3. (1) The board shall assign the principal or vice-principal to another position for which he or she is qualified. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 3 (1).

(2) The principal or vice-principal may be assigned to a position in a teachers’ bargaining unit if the position is vacant after the procedures under the applicable collective agreement for filling it have been exhausted. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 3 (2).

(3) The assignment takes effect on the date on which the principal’s or vice-principal’s position becomes redundant, or on such other date as the board and the principal or vice-principal may agree upon. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 3 (3).

content.content: 4. (1) The following rule applies if the principal or vice-principal is assigned to a position other than one described in subsection (2): 1. For one year after he or she begins work in the new position, he or she is entitled to be paid the salary that he or she would have been paid as principal or vice-principal. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 5. (2) Subsection (1) does not apply if the principal or vice-principal is assigned to a position in which he or she is employed, other than as a principal or vice-principal, to teach. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 5.
content.raw_html:
4. (1) The following rule applies if the principal or vice-principal is assigned to a position other than one described in subsection (2):

1. For one year after he or she begins work in the new position, he or she is entitled to be paid the salary that he or she would have been paid as principal or vice-principal. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 5.

(2) Subsection (1) does not apply if the principal or vice-principal is assigned to a position in which he or she is employed, other than as a principal or vice-principal, to teach. O. Reg. 90/98, s. 5.
5. Spent: O. Reg. 90/98, s. 5.
